item.title: Travel Map
item.description: I want to see as much of the world as possible while I can. The map I’m making here will serve as a reminder of the memories I made around the world, and as motivation to go out and see the rest. I’ve made the map in Rmarkdown so anyone reading who has a basic familiarity with R and Rstudio should be able to easily make their own. To make the map I used R, ggplot, and Google’s geolocation API.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I am a PhD student in Cornell’s Policy Analysis and Management program. I hold an MSc in Inequalities and Social Science from the London School of Economics and a BA in Psychology from the University of Winnipeg. Before starting at Cornell, I worked for two years as a data scientist and product manager at the people analytics firm Multi Health Systems Inc. I have experience in computational social science, product management, and team leadership.

item.title: extra_text
item.description: Through policy, governments set the rules of the game that all firms and workers play. I want to change the rules so that the game gives fairer rewards and everyone has a more equal chance at success. Why do people flock to major cities despite ever-rising costs of living? Why is competition declining across industries? How did elite education become a necessary and sufficient condition for economic success? Answering these questions requires accessing new kinds of data, revealing hidden social networks, identifying causal mechanisms, and understanding economic incentives.
